intro: Spermacoce minima, commonly known as the small bladderpod, is a small herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant has small, green, oval-shaped leaves and produces tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, bladder-like seeds. Spermacoce minima is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
